elements.title: Heaven on Earth: Art from Islamic Lands (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the exhibition Heaven on Earth: Art from Islamic Lands included art from the 8th to 19th centuries (object pictured)?

elements.title: Shah Suwar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a major parade took place in Cairo on 24 August 1472 for the hanging of Shah Suwar?

elements.title: 1901 Boston Marathon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ronald MacDonald was allegedly drugged with chloroform during the 1901 Boston Marathon, sabotaging his race?

elements.title: Mabe Fratti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that avant-garde musician Mabe Fratti's religious upbringing restricted her to classical and Christian music until she discovered file sharing on LimeWire?

elements.title: a North Carolina TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a North Carolina TV station broadcast from a "residential showplace" that was considered to be "one of [the] finest" houses in town?

elements.title: Valerija Narvydaitė (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lithuanian communist activist Valerija Narvydaitė spent more than 14 years in jails and detention centres?

elements.title: Not Strong Enough (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Not Strong Enough" by Boygenius describes conflicting mental states of self-hatred and self-importance?

elements.title: Ronald Reagan did not publicly mention AIDS (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ronald Reagan did not publicly mention AIDS until 1985, after more than 5,000 people in the United States had died from it?

elements.title: winter wonderland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that many winter wonderland fairs have become notorious as "winter blunderlands"?
